alert.note: Alert for Cortland (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 9:07PM EST until February 19 at 9:00PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New York... Tioughnioga River At Cortland affecting Cortland County. .Heavy rain will fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers will increase quickly and reach critical levels. For the Tioughnioga River Basin...including Cortland...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON TO LATE SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tioughnioga River At Cortland. * WHEN...From Friday afternoon to late Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Minor flood stage. Flooding leads to some closures along Kellogg Road to the south of Cortland. This impact does not include any effects from ice jams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM EST Thursday the stage was 3.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 8.4 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Saturday morning. This forecast does not include any effects from ice jams. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
